Reviews.Title: “Just right.”
Reviews.Author: Mary M
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights last week and was pleased with my stay. I felt the staff genuinely cared about the quality of my stay (I was already sold by the fact that the management clearly reads the TripAdvisor reviews, that was a factor that convinced me to come, so well done). There is a Tim Hortons attached to the lobby which is brilliant for breakfast or to grab a coffee before setting out on a walk to the wonderful city of Montreal. Great location, walking distance from Old Montreal (20 min or so), McGill (10 min or so), and just about anything else you could want. Basic, no frills kind of place, but it was just what I needed. Very comfy bed.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: cyberbenali
Reviews.Content: We reserved here because everywhere else was booked for one of the nights. Overall, the hotel needs an overhaul. The lobby is currently undergoing renovations so the desk area is small and crowded. In the room, it was VERY clean and, despite the creaky bed, the mattress was comfortable and generally slept well. The location is great: right downtown, 5 minutes down the hill to the metro and walking distance to St-Laurent and St-Denis streets with a great choice of excellent restaurants and entertainment. The service was friendly at the desk and we were informed the work underway in the hotel. On the downside, there is no fridge in the room which was a disappointment. However, the wireless internet was good even though I was on the top floor. The room needs to be repaired and generally brought up to modern stylings and necessary small repairs done. Parking is expensive, but it is downtown Montreal. Breakfast is not included. Chez Cora is across the street but CafÃ© Imagination on the corner with Sherbrooke is by far superior. In summary, you will be comfortable for the night if you have to, but there are other options in the area worth exploring.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a quick visit to MTL.”
Reviews.Author: Canadiansue
Reviews.Content: We needed a plce to stay overnight in Mtl, as we had an early morning medical appointment, and didn't want to face the morning traffic. We had enough Choice Priviledge Points for a free night, so we chose this hotel for the price, and location, as well as the reputation of the chain. The front desk staff was very helpful. We were given a very nice room, looks like it had been recently upgraded. It was very clean, and comfortable. We had no problems parking. We knew ahead of time that the lobby was under major renovations, and that there is a construction site next door. Since we had to leave soon after 7am, this didn't bother us.. If you are in for a quick overnight stay...I would highly recommend this place. If you are looking for a lazy, relaxed vacation, with a chance to sleep in..well...maybe you should go somewhere else till the renos and construction are finished.

Reviews.Title: “needs renovation badly”
Reviews.Author: Pheephox
Reviews.Content: although staff very helpful the lobby is being renovated and a shambles, the bathrooms needs work, and didn't seem completely clean although the room was pretty much. Light in bathroom that horrid kind of strip light which flickered and died and at time of writing I have still been waiting 15 mins for someone to come up. Meanwhile no use of bathroom as in total darkness and consequently unable to be on time for appointment, so besides lobby renovation needing to be finished the fixtures and fittings in bathroom need total overhaul, aircon noisy and in effectual, and room overlooked building site so constant background noise!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: emabo
Reviews.Content: We spent there a couple of nights. The hotel is pretty good: the room was huge for 2 people, it was clean, pity it was not possible having breakfast, as they were refurbishing the restaurant. Anyway, there are small beautiful cafes right next to the hotel. The position is perfect: 5 minutes walk and you're right in downtown, same distance to the nearest metro station, 1 minute to the nearest bus stop. In-room wi-fi, hotel parking (just a little less expensive than other parking lots nearby).

Reviews.Title: “good location terrible service”
Reviews.Author: dgmsd
Reviews.Content: we arrived tired after our flight to join a q to check in. there were 4 staff there .one was doing check in three were doing something else. A manager arrived and said why are are guests being left standing there and then she went to her office. Thirty minutes later we were checked into our very basic room.The service was poor Staff appeared to be from somewhere else as they did not even know basic things about the area. the beds were not always made.We felt that we were in a training hotel without the training.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for dropping off student at McGill”
Reviews.Author: SAJAToronto_Canada
Reviews.Content: Good basic hotel close to residences and student ghetto. Solid choice for parents delivering a student to university. If you are looking for a romantic stay in Montreal go to one of the many boutique hotels in the old city.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and very clean!”
Reviews.Author: major1018
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed here for 1 night when we attended the Just For Laughs Festival in Montreal. This hotel was literally just a few blocks from the festival and close to bars, clubs, restaurants, etc. It was very clean and it was definitely great for a one night stay. The only problem we had was that there was no more parking when we arrived, so we had to find another garage for our car. Overall it was a good experience though and I would definitely consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “nice place to visit”
Reviews.Author: melbrasil
Reviews.Content: the hotel is in a great location, close to everything, very good attendance at the hotel staff, but do not expect much luxury in the rooms, that if everything neat and clean but simple.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel for a one night stay”
Reviews.Author: TalbotTravellers
Reviews.Content: We needed to stay for one night only between long train journeys - but it was a Saturday in the height of summer, so it proved quite difficult to find somewhere that didn't have a two or three night minimum. However, this place was fine - quite near the metro (five minute uphill walk though, be prepared), clean, comfortable and quiet. No restaurant or bar, so no breakfast included in the room rate (about $100 I think) but there is a supermarket opposite for the cost conscious traveller, and we ate supper at a tiny creperie back towards the metro. Good for an overnight stay but would not inspire me to stay any longer. Plus, it was the weekend, so the building site next door was not in operation, but it might bother you if you are there midweek - our room overlooked a half-built building and it was very close (10-15 metres).

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: gymath
Reviews.Content: Our trip to Canada started off rough. We are from the USA. As we crossed into Canada our GPS stopped working, as did our phones. We were not expecting this! We depended on these items to get us where we were going! Hence, we were stressed trying to figure out where we were going. Once we arrived at the hotel we were greeted by a nice man at the counter who switched his French channel to English very quickly. I must say, that the entire time we were in Montreal we were impressed at how everyone spoke both French and English. Not one person was annoyed at switching over to English....very kind people! Parking was $17 a day. Good price for a downtown location. I would not park on the streets in this area and was happy to have my van parked safely under the hotel. When we got to our room we were pleased with the size. We were in room 315. Window had a huge crack in it. Dog barking in room next door....I think owners were out to dinner, but dog was quiet later. We were on a busy street and during the night you could hear people yelling in the streets, sirens whipping down the street and traffic. It didn't bother us really, and my kids slept through it. If this type of action bothers you, ask for a quieter location. The air conditioner was loud. No breakfast was served, which surprised me being a Choice Hotel. So we bought muffins and had coffee in the room. As far as location....great! Twenty feet cross the street was a grocery store and pharmacy. Subway restaurant around corner. Tons of places to eat. Go out front door of hotel, take a right and walk down the hill. Two blocks down is the Metro/underground city. Walk about a half mile and there's another Metro location. Walk a mile in total and you are right down where all the action is! Basilique Notre-Dame, beautiful! Went at 4:00 PM and organist was rehersing, closes at 5:00 PM, last people in at 4:30 PM. Adults $5, kids $4. Around the corner from the Basilique was the Montreal Science Centre....went about 6:00 PM...it's open until 9:00 PM. This was about $34 for a family of four. Great time to go because all the little kids were gone, not crowded. Our boys, ages 11 & 12 loved the Science Centre.....and the Basilique Notre Dame for that matter. Okay, my husband and I loved the science center too! Walked around Old Montreal after that....gift shops and lots of restaurants. Very happening place! Then we walked back up to the hotel....it's about a mile up hill....kids were tired and slept well. We went to LaRonde (Six Flags) while there. Easy to get to from hotel. (But traffic is tough in Montreal, be prepared and avoid the bridges during rush hour, you sit in traffic for an hour.) We used our season passes from home for LaRonde, so that was a no cost activity....well except for parking raking us for $20 at LaRonde. Another thing we did was drive up to Mount Royal Park and St. Joseph's du Mont Royal. It was a couple of miles away. At the park we stopped and took pictures, no cost to park. Then we went to St. Joseph's, $5 to park, but free to enter St. Joseph's. Another beautiful place. So, in conclusion, the location of this hotel was perfect. We used Choice points to pay for the room....we only paid for parking and tips for house keeping. If I was to visit this area again I would stay at this hotel. It smelled so clean and was the perfect location for my family. We are pretty simple people. Everyone at the front desk was friendly and spoke English. My laptop worked well. Coffee in lobby. Elevators were speedy. Nice place to stay. I hope you found this review helpful! Thanks Quality Hotel Downtown!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel value!!”
Reviews.Author: Shayda47
Reviews.Content: Loved the hotel. It was clean, the service was exceptional and it was in the perfect area. You are literally 10 minutes away from anything downtown. My room was a smoking room that smelt beautiful upon arrival. No scuffs, burn marks and the carpet was very clean!!! Oh ya, free street parking!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location with some drawbacks”
Reviews.Author: akissner
Reviews.Content: The Quality Hotel is in a great spot, with easy access to Old Montreal, McGill, Mont Royal Park, and tons of bars and restaurants. We went during the jazz festival, but not FOR the jazz festival, and the room was about $200/night CAD. It's reasonable to assume that's a lot more expensive than normal considering the whole city is booked solid during the festival. The hotel itself definitely looks a little tired. Everything is clean, but it just looked worn. I suppose it just looks like a budget hotel, which is what most people would call it. The staff was very pleasant and courteous. Check-in and check-out was easy and there were no major problems. The one major complaint was that the bed was like a concrete slab. Get in slowly or you might hurt yourself. Surprisingly, I got two decent nights' sleep but I guess I was just exhausted enough by the time my head hit the pillow. The other thing which we didn't have to deal with much, is that there's a crane that parks right outside for construction. We stayed during a weekend so we only saw it Monday morning. I would imagine it's worse if you stay during the week and they're working all day starting in the early morning. Overall, if you can get a reservation somewhere else for a little bit more money, I would go with that. Especially during peak times, it just doesn't make sense financially to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy hotel that caters to teams and student groups”
Reviews.Author: AJC59
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in this hotel many times over the years. It's location is great and they often have good prices. But over the last couple of years there have been more and more groups of young people (sports teams, "party-in-Montreal" tours from universities). The hotel is swarming with kids who party in their rooms and the corridors before and after visiting clubs. At our last visit earlier this month, we were put on the same floor as one of these groups. Although the lone hotel security guard tried his best to get them to be quiet, the hotel had created a situation that couldn't be managed. This was not the first time we had run into this problem at this hotel but it was the worst. So, my advice would be to go elsewhere if you want to sleep. On the other hand, if you don't plan on going to bed until 4 or 5 am, this may be the hotel for you!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay for first time Montreal-visitors”
Reviews.Author: ErnCasin
Reviews.Content: This place looks really great in their website. When we got there, we were welcomed with great staff. When we entered the room (2 Dble Bed, Non-Smoking) the place was super hot. The heater was turned on too high. But the biggest disappointment was the fact that the room was too small! The bathroom door does not even lock! The beds are not "bouncy" but it will not give you body pains. The hotel only has few floors so there is nothing to view, really, so regardless of which floor you go, it's all the same. The cab fare from this hotel to some of the famous attractions is in an average of $10-$15 (including tip). If you feel like walking, it's a 20min walk to Chinatown, 30min walk Notre Dame (which is also the area for the Old Montreal) and it's 10min walk to Downtown Montreal where you can do your shopping. This hotel is also conveniently located beside Cora's Breakfast, a grocery store, a pharmacy store, a Greek Restaurant, SAQ (liquour store) and Second Cup.

Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: andywilson810
Reviews.Content: A nice, clean hotel. I would recommend it. It's nothing fancy but definitely nice.

Reviews.Title: “delicious food in hotel's resturant”
Reviews.Author: maha6
Reviews.Content: i have visited in this hotel and i got great food at the hotel's restaurant. in quality hotel so much verity of Chinese dishes and so much more. if you want to get room in this hotel so you will really enjoy the great facilities of quality hotel as well. and specially its food, it is really fantastic. you can get from this hotel continental breakfast and hot coffee s well.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for the Price”
Reviews.Author: CdaFlyGirl
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location where you can walk to many things. I read about bed bugs at this hotel just before my trip so made sure to check while I was there. There were no bed bugs thank goodness, but I do not think that bed bugs provide an indication of the cleanliness of a hotel as many big chain, more expensive hotels are having this problem as it is right across North America. The hotel staff (front desk, cleaning staff etc) that we encountered where extremely helpful to the point of providing us with an umbrella as we where one short and it was pouring rain outside. Everyone was very friendly and helpful throughout our stay. I had second thoughts about staying at this hotel after reading some reviews but my experience was very good and I would stay there again. I think reviews need to be taken with a grain of salt as it really does depend on your own standards and being reasonable. If you pay for a 3 star then you get a 3 star hotel, you cannot stay at a 3 star hotel and expect to have 5+ star service. If you want 5+ star service then pay the price for a 5+ star hotel and stay there. Overall great time in Montreal and the hotel was great.

Reviews.Title: “Never stay in this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: karenmooi
Reviews.Content: Our hotel room was as clean as it could be considering there was mold growing on the bathroom ceiling, a large hole cut in the carpet, and room and bathroom doors that would not fit into the frame unless kicked. Graffitti on the outside walls of the hotel was our first warning, but we were committed to stay. Parking cost and extra $20 dollars and you had to give the hotel receptionist your car keys so the parking lot guy could move the car if he needed too--I did this with great reluctance in a strange ciy. Anyway, choose another place to stay.....even at our employee discount price, it wasn't worth it.

Reviews.Title: “BED BUGS!!!!! And the Management did NOT care”
Reviews.Author: Toronto21
Reviews.Content: My sons spent a night at this hotel and their beds were infested with bed bugs. When they showed the bed bug pictures and bites, the management did not seem too concerned and were not at all amendable to any compensation and told them no other room was available. Please think twice about staying at this hotel. It is close to the McGill Stadium, but it's not worth it. We are VERY disappointed esp by the response by management!!!! Disgusting, actually and definitely poor quality at the Quality. The MacDonalds of Oakville

Reviews.Title: “Hotel ok, customer service needs work”
Reviews.Author: cpagia
Reviews.Content: Not really sure how to rate the hotel. The room was ok, location very handy about halfway between Mont Royal and Old City. Parking was very expensive (and more on this later). On one night a small gang of street bums was parked on the curb outside, but this was a problem around Montreal. Price I paid was neither cheap nor expensive, although boosted by parking fee. On my stay, the parking garage was to close after a couple of nights, so I asked for recommendations on where to park the car instead. The parking station 2 blocks away was less than half the price on the weekends, so after 1 night in the hotel parking we left at 10am to do touristing things then returned after 6pm to take advantage of the after 6pm rates and cheap weekend parking. Over the weekend we discovered free on street parking two streets over, so then used that. At checkout I handed in my parking voucher and was told I would have to pay for every night until their garage was shut up because I hadn't handed it in earlier. Apparently you were meant to return the voucher when you stopped using the parking. I was never told this, even when asking about other parking options. I said not acceptable, and they finally agreed to waive the parking fees if I could provide evidence I had parked in the parking garage. I eventually found my ticket stub and presented it to them. Now they insisted I pay for an extra day as their parking only allowed up to midday and the garage stub showed 6.15pm as time ofd entry. I again said that this was unacceptable and that we had left at 10am. After more heated argument, they agreed to charge me only half a day. Still further argument and they agreed to waive the fee if they could keep the ticket stub. By this stage I was quite annoyed - I have never had such an experience in any hotel anywhere, and we do quite a bit of travelling. This cast a bit of a pall over a stay which had otherwise been fine. Just to round it all off, a charge of $3.95 later appeared on my credit card. I emailed the hotel and got lots of bouncing email replys, so wasn't sure whether anyone had got the message. So I emailed Choice head office and miraculously everything was suddenly fixed. Apparently the charge was for a large bottle of water that was in the room and we had used, which we had not as we carry our own bottles to fill from the tap. This was refunded with no great apology or other recompense, so after exchange rates I am probably still out of pocket a dollar :-) But the bad taste of the experience remains. Compare if you like with my review of Treasure Island in Vegas and thier response to customer service issues. SInce 2007 I have spent 9 months travelling and staying in hotels. This was by far the worst customer service experience in that whole time.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: Yayavar37
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights with spouse and daughter. The hotel is centrally located in downtown on Rue de Parc. Montreal otherwise also is a very walkable city. Room was no frills but comfortable and clean. Service was efficient. Hotel staff was very helpful. The area is dotted with eating places and within walking distance to all places of interest. Breakfast was not included in the room rate but the hotel breakfast was very good value for money. There were three or four options for breakfast unlike a buffet and each one individually cooked and served. Like most budget hotels in Europe (unlike America) there was no bell desk, but the reception staff was helpful.

Reviews.Title: “I'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: MissDestructo
Reviews.Content: Loved the Quality! Was my second home for a week! I checked in late and was able to get a room right away. Friendly staff. Upgraded to a corner king room for an extra $10, worth it! Fridge, hallway and huge king sized bed. Quiet, Hot water is hot, rooms are very clean and housekeeping is friendly. Perfect location, supermarket across street, subway stop 3 min walk, Cora's breakfast across street. Internet was fast unless uploading photos... I miss it already!

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and cosy”
Reviews.Author: SarahBella
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Quality Hotel in April and got a great rate on Priceline, $55 for the night! We did have to pay an additional $10 for a room with two queen beds instead of one king sized bed, so heads up! The room was nice and clean and did the job. There is a Cora's breakfast cafe across the street (YUM!!) also there was a 24hr corner store... came in handy if you were coming back to your room late and wanted a snack. The front desk staff were very helpful and friendly, they offered us maps of the city right away and asked if we needed any more information about tourist attractions. Were very pleasant to deal with. About a 20 min walk to Crescent Street...close to shopping areas. All in all, would probably stay there again! Have fun in Montreal!

Reviews.Title: “their are much better hotels in montreal for the same money”
Reviews.Author: aroundtheworld24088
Reviews.Content: the real problem with this hotel is paper thin walls .if you have traveled even a little you know that is a huge reason not to ever stay here.my other reasons for disliking this place are not as extreme but are notable . the front desk manager is very rude when dealing with people. joyce the receptionist should be a manager she is very professional . i hope the general manager reads this and promotes her .joyce reminds me of hotel staff i have only encountered at upscale european business hotels. the last thing is the room .the cleaning lady is doing her job .however new shower curtains should be bought. fabric shower curtains get stained then look gross .the rooms are clean .just some stains on shower curtain and towels .also stained towels should always be thrown out. i just remembered their internet is highly regulated... .meaning email and lite surfing. nazi like with throttling bandwidth you wont be able to do anything intensive.is someone actually on a server watching everything you do? .i hate when hotels do this its so sick .

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Techboy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a 2-3 minute walk from the Place des Arts station. Downtown is a 15 minute walk or 5 minute metro ride. Old Montreal/Chinatown is also a 15 minute walk away. I arrived at this hotel around 12:30 PM and was promptly given a room on the top floor. Staff were always friendly and helpful with any questions I had. No free breakfast but lots of places to eat around hotel including a Cora's across the street. Also a Provigo is across the street so very convenient however there was no fridge or microwave in my room. No free pc to use but there is free wireless internet access. The charge for the pc was I think $3 for 20 minutes. You can go across the street to the 24 hour internet cafe which charged $4 for 1 hour. One thing to be aware of is a new building is supposed to go up next door but construction hadn't started yet when I stayed there.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great location”
Reviews.Author: klpringleo
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights and had a great stay overall. The hotel is in a great location downtown Montreal, close to several great restaurants, shopping, bars, and parks. Even though we were right downtown, we found the hotel nice and quiet. The staff were very nice and helpful directing us around the city. The rooms are nothing special but have everything you need if you are mainly just going to be using your room for sleeping and as a base point.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: funkytravel
Reviews.Content: We have now stayed at this hotel 3 times over the past 3 years and we find it very convenient in location to both downtown and McGill university. We have always had clean rooms and courteous staff. The air conditioning always worked, we always had internet accessible and it met all of our expectations. We found it easy to walk downtown or take the subway which is only a block away. The university is easily accessed. The restaurant leaves something to be desired, but just a 10 minute walk leads you to some of the best restaurants in Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “No attention to detail, No Parking, Bums sit outside and beg”
Reviews.Author: Landlord646
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a visit to Montreal and (unfortunately) stayed at this hotel. We had stayed here a few years ago because I had "free" nights, but was unhappy then due to the hard beds and lack of parking (despite the advertising!)...anyway, decided to give them another chance due to the "Sweet Deals" promotion by Montreal-Tourisme - stay 2 nights, get the third free, continental breakfast, and other gifts and promotions for the Laugh Festival, held nearby. Once again, there was no on-site parking available - had to park down the street at a non-secure outdoor lot where the local bums congregated at night. Was informed that there was NO continental breakfast offered - later corrected and given vouchers for a continental breakfast at Cora's(choice of a bagel, cold cereal, or oatmeal) , across the street; however no gifts or promotions for booking as promised (and no effort to rectify after showing the ad to a manager!); a pair of panties left hanging on the bathroom door from a previous guest; dirty bed linens, and an air conditioner that didn't work (but was fixed). The small room refrigerator needed to be defrosted, but worked OK for the items purchased at the Provigo supermarket located across the street (where they charge you 5 cents per bag!) Late night returning would find one or two of the local bums sitting on the bench outside the hotel, (as well as throughout the general neighborhood) asking for handouts! The general location is OK for tourists, near a Metro station, and you can walk (a long walk!) to the Old Port and to the nightime activities on Crescent St. However, for the price charged ($191CAD) for the king-suite (a rather small room) there are other, superior choices in Montreal, with this hotel to be bypased by me in the future, no matter how many "free" nights I can get!

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly Pleasant”
Reviews.Author: TrippingAllOver
Reviews.Content: Four of us were in Montreal for one night. We needed two rooms, each with two beds as we wanted the comfort and privacy of not sharing beds. The hotel had to be close to McGill and we were on a budget. This hotel met all our needs. I was unsure of what to expect because it is a smaller hotel. It was wonderful. The staff was friendly and helpful. The rooms were clean, comfortable and elegant. It was like staying at larger, luxury hotels, except the rooms were a bit smaller, though still a good size. The hotel was well maintained, the beds were comfortable, the furnishing and linen fresh. No run down feel here. We'll book here next time in Montreal whether we're on a budget or not.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: brentio
Reviews.Content: It is a very nice hotel in a great location. We were with a group and all rooms were nice and updated. One room the t/v didn't work and we phoned down and they said it would be fixed, but it never was. It didn't matter much because we were only there for 1 night. Overall great hotel in nice area.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal, great location”
Reviews.Author: fflbrgst
Reviews.Content: I was skeptical about this hotel before arriving from some of the bad online reviews - but even the much more expensive hotels in the city also have some bad reviews! The room (1 queen, pull out small sofabed) was a little small, but not cramped. Bed was hard, and pillows marshmallowy, but not bad. TV was very small in a cabinet that also was the clothes chest and "closet". The door concealing the TV would swing closed when you walked by it - minor annoyance. The bathroom was clean and modern with decent water pressure in the shower. Elevators were always fast and desk clerks pleasant. Great location - half a block from Sherbrooke Ave where all the higher priced hotels are. 2 blocks from the Metro entrance. Half a block from a 24 hour Second Cup coffee shop. 4 blocks from McGill. $15 a night for secure parking is a good deal - most hotels are charging $25 and many of the stand-alone lots are not secure.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad, Not Great”
Reviews.Author: Love2Travel85
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Quality Hotel September 20-22. The best part about this hotel is the location; you're right in the heart of downtown Montreal, only a few blocks' walk from a variety of shops, restaurants, bars and night clubs. The downsides? Some of the rooms are very outdated (friends of ours had better luck in other rooms). For example, our room had a very old TV that had the alarm clock built-in! The mini-bar is $10 per day, and our fridge was really old. The bedding also left a little to be desired - very firm mattress, average sheets/pillows, and a comforter that had the color and texture of a burlap sack. The front desk attendants also warned us to watch our luggage, bags, etc. everywhere we went in the hotel outside of our room. They said that unattended bags are always getting stolen, especially from the lobby. However, I'm sure this isn't unique to this particular hotel; it probably happens anywhere in downtown hotels. All in all, if you're looking for a decently-priced hotel with basic amenities but access to all that downtown Montreal has to offer, this is the hotel for you. If you want a hotel experience that's anything above ordinary, I suggest you look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: JayKwanza
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised. Great location, clean room, except for funky smell when we first came in, but I believe it was attributed to the maid just cleaning our room before we got there and cleaning tools may have been the culprit becasue the smell eventually dissapeared (like wet mop or used wet towel smell). It was just confined to the bathroom, and like i said, went away after a while, so we didn't complain. If you're simple people, or have a family, this is the place to be. I'll summarize and keep it short with my pro's and cons below: Pros: 1) location, location, location! short walk to subway, st. catherine street, st. laurent st, mont royal parc, old montreal, etc - perfect location! (across the street from a supermarket and tons of restaurants nearby) and close to subway too! 2) friendly and informative staff 3) Parking, high $15 fee, but worth it with the in and out privelages 4) Clean and overall inviting feeling of hotel. Cons: 1) parking lot got full, and if you left, you might not get your spot back. But we left the car parked anyway, so it didn't bother us. 2) Funky "wet smell" in bathroom that eventually went away. Overall, a great value and cool place if you're looking to save doe on hotels, and use that saved doe for the night clubs or retaurants!

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, bad experience”
Reviews.Author: AdrianaToronto
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel one weekend in July. It's in a good location, walking distance from Vieux Montreal and Rue Sainte-Catherine. The room size was good and clean. Unfortunately, they decided to paint our floor without telling us beforehand. We get off the elevator on our floor, to find a worker spray painting the hall. He freaked out and shoved us off the floor. We couldn't get into our room, and had inhaled toxic fumes! The front lobby told us that they left a message at our room, about changing rooms. We checked - it was left close to 11:30 am the same day! The hotel staff had to get all of our stuff. It was not a good scene. We had to wait until the general manager was in Monday - we were going to be credited for one night's stay. But it took me several emails and phone calls over 2 weeks to finally get my credit card deducted. It's too bad because the hotel was fine otherwise. But the whole experience left a bad taste in my mouth.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel I have ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: greeneyes_traveler
Reviews.Content: We staying at this hotel during Grand Prix weekend 3 adults and 1 infant. For over $1500 for 3 nights we were incredibly disappointed. The only thing that was good about this place is that they let us check in at 11 am because of the baby. After that it was all downhill. We were told the hotel had Wi-Fi access, and it did not, when we went to get a cable it did not work. We called down to the front desk and they informed us that the 8th floor did not have internet! On the second day (Saturday) we left the hotel at 9 am to head to the race track. When we arrived back at the hotel at 3 pm we found our door left open! On top of that our room was not made. Nor did any one come to make it. We called down to make a complaint and they told us that someone would be up to check our door lock. They told us that the results were inconclusive and that it must have been us who left the door open. Sunday We left at 9am again I arrived back at 2:30 with the baby, again the room was not made. When the maid came by I was feeding the baby on the couch and all she did was put a dirty towel back up on the rack. Throw some towels in the washroom and change a garbage, plus she left the door open again! Which I did not notice until my brother came back because I was on the couch the whole time and could not see the door! When my brother called to the front desk they said there was nothing they could do and that he would have to wait to see the manager the next morning. Every time we asked for something they told us they didn't have it. We ate breakfast at the restaurant and the food was absolutely horrific. However our waitress was very very kind and gave great service. We want a refund for our stay because they have a 100% Satisfaction guarantee that if there is a problem that is not solved they will issue a refund. When we mentioned this, they said nothing. Overall it was the worst hotel experience I have ever had I will never be back to this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Stay”
Reviews.Author: FrenchDove
Reviews.Content: We were two adults and two teenagers that arrived at the Hotel on a sunday and planned to stay till tuesday but changed our mind after one night. Ask for the connection to internet and was told that they didn't have any left. Television picture was very snowy and every time you shut it off....it had to be unblocked by the front staff. We ask questions about the area and the clerk couldn't answer us. Parking at 15.00 a night is a bit expensive. The restaurant attached to the hotel is great and the service was exceptional with good food.

Reviews.Title: “Great place!”
Reviews.Author: MS08
Reviews.Content: I visited this place as a solo traveller as I got a great rate from Expedia. For its location and price, you can't go wrong. The room was comfortable and very clean, although the room could have been a little warmer, given it was the depth of winter. Lovely, friendly staff and a supermarket across the street, made this an enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “great experience would do it all over again”
Reviews.Author: habsd9
Reviews.Content: We are from Victoria BC and visited Montreal for the first time in January 2008, my son, myself and 2 friends. We were there for the habs game and everything was perfect. Front counter staff was very helpful and everything you need is very close to the hotel. Being first time visitors to Montreal, we were glad we could experience the night life without taxing all over the place. Beautiful view of the city line aswell. Also very close to Bell Centre. Paid corporated rate so it wasn't too expensive, two double beds and a couch. Would we go again, YES and stay at the same place. Thanks for a great time. go habs go!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly Acceptable!!”
Reviews.Author: DJTravelBoy
Reviews.Content: I got a very good rate on Hotwire for a five night stay over the long Coumbus Day/Canadian Thanksgiving weekend. The hotel is located on a decent street near McGill. Walking distance to most everything and very close to a Metro for everything else. Very nice supermarket right across the street. You really cannot beat the convenience or the price for a basic, clean hotel experience. Room was clean and well maintained. Nicely organized, although no closet at all. Free ethernet Internet service. My only issues were with lack of follow-up at the Front Desk when my lost luggage arrived and a lack of organization or logic with housekeeping that kept my room from being made up for my first three days at the hotel. The latter was somewhat caused by my schedule but the housekeeper did not follow up and clean my room when I was actually away from the hotel as I had asked. It was this general lack of communication among hotel staff members that caused the only disappointments during my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: AncientGirl
Reviews.Content: The room was clean, the bed was good, the tv was 29" flat, well located, staff sometimes gently but sometimes not. There is a subway station near and a market in front of the hotel. We stood there for 4 days. we had a little problem with the door lock - it didn't open but it was solved quickly.

Reviews.Title: “Pricey for its class”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkCitySusoo
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located on the outskirts of hotel row off sherbrooke boulevard PROS: Location is across street from supermarket â€¢ walking to Old Montreal is about 20 minutes â€¢ Metro stop is about 5 min. walk â€¢ good continental breakfast if your package includes â€¢ parking in facilities(extra cost) â€¢ 4 pillows per bed was helpful CONS: Very pricey for quality of hotel â€¢ beds were uncomfortable â€¢ furniture is from the 1980s â€¢ room had musky odor (when told of problem, the fix was to spray the room with a scent) â€¢ Carpets were worn and quite dirty â€¢ AC didn't work so well â€¢ only 2 people operated front desk when we were there (we were a bit concerned since upon arrival, two homeless persons were sitting in front of the hotel staring at us)

Reviews.Title: “Good location - high price”
Reviews.Author: edz34
Reviews.Content: I inquired about the price and the man at the front desk quoted me a price. I asked if there was parking. He said 'no' but recommended a lot. I left to check the parking. When I came back the price had gone up. The hotel was OK otherwise. The location is good. Park on the street if you have a car. The parking instructions are in french. Have somebody translate what the parking rules are. Everybody speaks english.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Value in the heart of the action!”
Reviews.Author: chrystalm
Reviews.Content: Boyfriend and I stayed in the hotel on our way through to Atlantic Canada. Clean, comfortable rooms at a great price. Wonderful location in the heart of downtown Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location! Great Staff!”
Reviews.Author: sweetestsin
Reviews.Content: I felt that this hotel was wonderful! As two couples of 24 year olds, all first timers to Montreal, we we're not too sure what to expect. After fist finding our way to another Quality Inn and being scared for our lives by the outside view, we were happy to realize that we were at the wrong Quality. After finding our way to the hotel, everything from there on was perfect. As Choice Privilege members, we did inquire about our complimentary upgrade. They had upgraded rooms available but we would not be able to have close rooms. An employee escorted us to view the rooms to decide if we wanted to upgrade and be apart, or keep the original rooms and be connecting. The upgrade rooms were a tiny bit larger, but did not offer much else except a mini fridge, so we chose to stay in our lower grade rooms. The hotel is RIGHT across the street from a grocery store that is open late, where you can purchase some alcohol, snacks, breakfast foods, etc, if you want to save on some money. We did dine in the adjoining restaurant in the hotel. The food was good, but the waitress appeared fairly absent minded.. forgetting plenty of our requests. Our room also had floor to ceiling windows that overlooked the street which was nice to watch the hustle and bustle (and people watch the shoppers in the grocery store). The hotel is within walking distance to all of the main streets for shopping, and there are a multitude of restaurants once you step outside. There is a daily fee for secured parking in the underground parking lot. The front desk staff were very helpful, from the moment we inquired about viewing both room types before deciding whether to upgrade, right up until we checked out. One of the girls at the front desk (I really wish I could remember her name) was great. As we didn't know much about Montreal, we wanted to experience a bit of the nightlife but weren't sure were to head. She let us know what clubs would be busy on what evenings, and even called a friend of hers that was dj'ing at one of the clubs to get us placed on the guestlist and some complimentary drinks. On our last evening, after a heavy night of drinking we did not end up checking out to nearly 1:30 p.m, and no one called our room to kick us out! :) Unfortunately, I cannot say if the price was worth our stay as we had a Quality Inn Employee discount (which means we had a very cheap rate), but I am pretty confident that it would be worth the full price (even if the hotel was terrible, I would pay it for the location only!) The next time I return to Montreal, I will definitely be staying at this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “terrible experience, don't go there”
Reviews.Author: traveladvice1
Reviews.Content: I had a terrible experience there. These people promise you one thing but do something else. They simply lie. Do yourself a favour and avoid this place.

Reviews.Title: “Good price, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: TravellerGal
Reviews.Content: We booked the Quality Hotel Downtown for a girls trip to Montreal. The price was extremely frugal ($45 USD on Priceline.com). Although with the parking ($15/day) and the charge of $10/day for a non-smoking room, drove the costs up a bit. Priceline had originally booked us into a smoking queen room but we needed two doubles non-smoking. I had called ahead to the hotel twice to request that but was told that I would have to take my chances at check-in. Luckily, we did get the room we wanted. We loved the hotel for it's convenient location...it's within walking distance to St. Catherine and only one block away from St. Laurent. The rooms were clean and the beds were hard and comfortable. Pillows were a bit lacking so if you're picky about those, I suggest bringing your own. It's nothing fancy but it was perfect for us.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money!”
Reviews.Author: philadams68
Reviews.Content: We didn't have any idea what to expect with this hotel & we were pleasantly surprised. We had a 2 night stay & found this hotel to be awesome. Great location, very friendly front desk staff. Rooms clean & good size. Supermarket across the road. Metro station 2 blocks away. Very happy to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience!!!”
Reviews.Author: nancy_rhodes
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the QH Downtown from October 7-11, 2005. To be honest, I really expected the worst based on some of the reviews below. However, I was absolutely surprised and pleased with my stay at this hotel and would definitely stay here again in the future. 1) The hotel is located one block away from Sherbrooke, one of the main streets in Downtown Montreal. It's also a 10 minute walk from St. Laurent ("The Main"), one of the most ultra-hip and exciting streets in the city. It sits on the edge of downtown but is closer to The Plateau, the artistic district of Montreal. (Great inexpensive restaurants and bars in the area, including some restaurants where you can bring your own wine!) It is also less than a 5 minute walk from Jeanne Mance (ever seen photos of the iron staircases in Montreal? Chances are they were taken on Jeanne Mance street.). 2) The hotel is directly across the street from Provigo, a well-stocked and clean grocery store (check out their pastry section!). It was WONDERFUL (and inexpensive) to zip across the street and pick up provisions for the weekend. 3) The only problem I encountered was that the movie channels would not work when I arrived. Rachelle at the front desk went above and beyond to try to get them to work again Friday evening and continued to follow up with me throughout the weekend to get them functional. 4) The restaurant was closed while I was there, but there is a local restaurant (Alto - pick up a menu in the lobby) who will deliver as late as 5:00 a.m.!!! Good food, quick delivery. I highly recommend their pizza. 5) I found the front desk staff to be accommodating, warm, and very helpful. They went above and beyond to ensure I had a good stay. All in all, it was a very good experience. Granted, this isn't a four star hotel, but you get a great value for the price.

Reviews.Title: “It's not bad”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: It is fine if you just want a base from which to explore the city. It is nowhere as scary as the "Never Again" post would indicate. I got spooked by that post and ended up booking another hotel for the first three days of my stay. Yes, that other hotel (2.5*) is head and shoulders above the 2* Quality Downtown, but if you happened to get this hotel from Priceline, don't worry and enjoy your stay as long as your aim is to explore the city instead of worrying about the service level of your hotel. The neighborhood is a mix of downtown businesses and student housing. On Sherbrooke, which is only 1/2 a block away, it's all businesses and posh hotels. On Ave du Parc, it's a mixture of convenient stores, restaurants, outdoor cafes, and a supermarket. The hotel is also within walking distance of the Metro and St. Laurent where a lot of Montreal nightlife takes place. The point is if McGill students managed to live through 4 years of their education living in this neighborhood, you'll be OK for a few days.

Reviews.Title: “Quality is Adequate”
Reviews.Author: bman13
Reviews.Content: Me and a few friends just returned from a weekend stint at this hotel. As said before this hotel is a 3 star. You get what you pay for. It provides you with the basics. A Room with A.C., adequate beds, trademark flat hotel pillows, and maid service. It is a great hotel because of its location. Close to Supermarket, Liquor Store, and the club scene and night life is all within walking distance. As said before last year I stayed at the Delta nearby on President Kennedy and that is a cut above but that is a 4 star and well you pay more. It's around $15 or so per day for parking in the garage. We just parked it when we arrived and took it out when we left. Close by to everything. We were on a floor with an ice machine. If you are in need for ice like we were it does the job but if you are looking for a large amount of ice in a short amount of time it may do the job but not real quick. Maid on the last day since we didnt ask for maid service sort of yelled/informed us about how "NOT TO OPEN THE WATER" she was saying not to open the bottle of water in the room that is on the table and just replace it with tap water and how she would know. Found that okay a little weird cause who is going to drink a medium size bottle of water that is $3.50? All in all no real complaints. When we requested more towels we got them. Front Desk when going in and out were friendly. If you plan on staying in the hotel for a while during the day when your not out then the hotel doesnt really have time consuming things. It is simply put ADEQUATE for people that just need a place to stay that will give you a place to sleep (in smoking and non-smoking) and any of the other basics. If you lookin for more its going to cost you more.

Reviews.Title: “Location,location,location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had a good deal in hotwire,it just us$45/night(tax not included) we booked the hotel for 5 nights,what can ask for this price in the downtown.The room is fine,the front desk is quite helpful.but the most important thing is the location,you can walk to metro for less than 5 min(but I can't imagine in the winter),the bus stop just the corner(check for the time ,30min in non-rush hour)if you want to the old montreal/chinatown, either bus or walk is fine ,it a straight road.Easy to access anywhere like shopping,sightseeing... There's supermarket across the street,very convenient,not only the supermarket,a bakery,couples of resturant,Cara is the place we went twice,try the breakfast, the crepe filled with lot of fruit,dip with nutella,very great. I saw some beggars beg for money along the streets,I experienced a beggar came to me for the money when I walked from the metro to hotel.And one night we saw a man slept at the front door of the hotel,few people looking at him,the staff of hotel came out and ask something ,then she returned to the hotel,it seems this happen before(a woman walking along and said he just faking always)So i advised girls to be watched out when you have to go out at night. One more thing,you have to pay $10/day for the high speed internet,really expensive,and when we called the service desk ask about the service detail,she gave us wrong information,the service should be from noon to noon,but the one one the phone said its from midnight to midnight,so be careful.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good price.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My friends and I spent a few nights in this hotel and were pleasantly surprised. I guess we had low expectations but everything turned out great. The parking is in a secure garage and the food in the restaurant downstairs was great. We got a really good deal on the rooms from expedia so we weren't sure what to expect for the price. We were in walking distance to a lot of places and there's a grocery store right across the street. I'd probably stay there again if I ever go back to Montreal again. This is a perfect hotel if you plan on sightseeing Montreal and go places.

Reviews.Title: “bang for the buck, it has lots of value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great location, just 1 block off of the center of St Catherine street. Close to the local subway which I found so easy to navigate. Private Garage asures safe parking. Great resturaunt called Mango's adjacent to the hotel located on the main floor. ( they serve a great breakfast) and keep a well stocked bar. The Front Desk was an excellent help, always happy to make dinner reservations for us and never being off when recamending a place to eat or visit. The rooms were clean & quaint, the bathroom is a bit small but definetly sufficent, the tub was deep enough for me to soak my 6 foot 240 pound frame which is nice after a day off treking around the city. Right accross the street is a full service grocery store(great for the budget concious) or if you just need something you forgot to pack. Considering I paid less then $300 for a 4 night stay I would recamend this hotel and may even stay there again. It would have been nice to have a few more amenities (like a pool) but hey I was there to see the city not lounge around a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Cresent Street NIGHTLIFE!! NIGHTLIFE!!”
Reviews.Author: LarryN1
Reviews.Content: The Quality Inn Downtown on Crescent Street 1 block south of St Catherines has been recently refurbished and is clean and safe. No it's not the Ritz but for $65-$90.00 USD depending on the season also consider the fact that within a 6 block radius of the Quality there is some of the best nightlife on this continent...!!!!!!!!!Restaurants, Cafes, Bars, Disco, Jazz, Rock, Irish, sophisticated to grunge, and when the bars close at 3 (If you have been there for a while they close the doors at 3 and let you stay till 4 usually drinking for free by now if you had been taking care of your bartender) now you only have a two short blocks to stumble home to your hotelWhen checking in ask for Jerry (one of the managers) introduce your self to him and he will take excellent care of you!! Larry

HotelInfo.Name: Quality Hotel Downtown
HotelInfo.Address: 3440 avenue du Parc, Montreal, Quebec H2X 2H5, Canada
